documents.document: @emmetmalone @HistoryLOI No team containing Franco Baresi and I has ever conceded a goal. Fact.
@DrNightdub @FMcMack I was there. Easily the loudest - but not the best - of the three Ramones gigs I attended during the 70s-80s.
@TheFinal_Third Great night! Good to meet @acjimbo again after a gap of 24 years.
@FMcMack @bboyd27 @IrishTimesOpEd I'll say one thing for Trump: he's not Sting
@DeborahJaneOrr @guardian Is that 'bake' news?
@seidodge @AdamSchefter You should read Joe O'Connor's book about various Dublins in the USA. Fascinating.
@jwalshireland @FMcMack And that's why I buy the SBP
@davidbyrne72 All the best Dave. Hope you're not up to early to see what Santa's brought. ⛄️💤
@buzzoneill Saw them in 1973. Amazing gig!
@ttsrfc @historyloi @markmccadden @mclaughlingavin Two ten-team divs is fair if all we have is 20 clubs. What's the problem?
@ttsrfc @historyloi @markmccadden @mclaughlingavin Would Rovers' fans prefer more games against Cabinteely or UCD than Pat's or Bohs?
@CorrAlan Spare us the gorey details
@DrNightdub @seidodge @luke_oriordan @juliancanny I grew up in the single division years. All it bred was stagnation.
@Glinner @leyawn Reminds me of coolfizzinpepsi
@seidodge @luke_oriordan @juliancanny It's basically deckchairs on the Titanic but at least it creates two equal divisions
@HistoryLOI @McLaughlinGavin @markmccadden @buzzdotie A 16-team single division would merely recreate the stagnation of the past
@McLaughlinGavin @HistoryLOI @markmccadden @buzzdotie So stick with an eight-team First Division? At least with ten there's parity.
@patmontague Many Hoopy returns Pat, to you and yours
@davidbyrne72 Wouldn't put it past them either
@patrickfarrell9 Indeed. Give us a shout and we'll arrange something.
@davidbyrne72 No Xmas presents in Turin. Santa's gonna skip that town.
@noriordan In fairness he's a new kid on the block
@garethpenrose That's what passes for thorough research these days
@seidodge @ScotsFootyCards The King! Adored him when I was a kid.
@fitzmaidan Get someone to take out the batteries
@seidodge It's just a posh word for spoofer. Only the clueless or cowardly use consultants.
@seidodge Really enjoyed that tournament. My eldest son and I adopted Turkey and they went on to win it at the then home of the Hoops.
@DrNightdub @luke_oriordan We're living in worse than interesting times.
@DrNightdub @luke_oriordan LoI point-scoring's a very subtle art. We're all in a sociological dustbin.
@DrNightdub @luke_oriordan Serious pot-kettle situation there. How many homes have Pat's had over the years? Milltown included.
@luke_oriordan Just refer to it as the U2 loft and you can't go wrong
That @JohnBishop100 is sound. Here's what happened when that JB met this JB: https://t.co/QnhFtKwafQ https://t.co/Z3uHu3DC1K
@seidodge People can slag RTE as much as they like but nights such as this show what it's all about
@seidodge It's what your new sofa was made for
@seidodge I recall when my eldest son was told by school pal there was no Santa I told him to tell pal there was no god
@seidodge We're deffo in the twilight zone end of things. Which is much more fun. Plus there's less face painting and fewer silly hats.
@seidodge What a load of corporate bollocks
@PhuckAllCraic Smith's Irish potato crisps. The noisiest crisps in the world.
@phuckallcraic I did indeed. I'd give anything for a number 11 badge now.
Napoleon Solo was a hero to me. Robert Vaughn RIP. The greatest ever quiff is gone.
@FMcMack @MaxBoot @ForeignPolicy I've lived through Bertie, Reagan and Thatcher. Bring it on!
@buzzoneill @rice_e @ShamrockRovers Dundalk proved Rovers' EL qualification wasn't some fluke #MONGAWA
@FCUnitedMcr @BPAFCOfficial Looking forward to my first trip to Broadhurst Park. C'mon FC!
@johngosullivan @pajoflynn Ronaldo will sleep easily now that you've hung up your boots!👍 All the best Pat.
@colinjforde @seidodge @johngosullivan @HOTSHOTZ2 @cahill_ashley @Denis_Hurley So why don't they play in LoI and prove it?
@historyloi @peile50yearsago It's a 19th Century creation: 2 full and 3 half backs, 2 inside forwards, 2 wingers and a centre forward
@phuckallcraic @emmetmalone Irish people just don't fancy club sport. GAA and rugby clubs also attract relatively tiny crowds. It's endemic.
@macdarabueller @emmetmalone @extratimenews If Dundalk won the Europa League I'd imagine the Irish reaction: 'It's only the Europa League.'
@kevinbrannigans He may be a hopeless narcissist, but all else about him is impossible to resist.
Anyone out there got a stream link for #NapoliRoma?
How come Smokey Robinson never got a #NobelPrize for Literature? https://t.co/XIE7WsK2xR

For more on #BobDylan's #NobelPrize win and video: https://t.co/fR0WqY5Hqd https://t.co/NUFBeYyZqe
@gleesonb The greatest slaw ever is Denis Law
@johngosullivan Easily the most interesting and entertaining new face on the LoI scene. In a world full of clones and cliches he stands out.
@HistoryLOI @EmmaAWheatley I think you're missing his point there
@sundaybusiness @TomLyonsBiz Best Irish newspaper by a long stretch. Always insightful and informative. 👍
@17Leagues24cups No chance. Dundalk and Cork are just better than the rest. We're still a top four side. Just way behind top two.
@davidbyrne72 @JerryPijpelink We lost 8-0 on aggregate if that was a European tie. We've come a long way since 2011.
@davidbyrne72 @JerryPijpelink Decent first half. Showing a bit of hunger. Tough for Dobbs up front alone though.
I saw a film today, oh boy! #Beatles #EightDaysAWeek https://t.co/u26iQDvXVY https://t.co/gaZsBcAirh
@davidbyrne72 @FMcMack @ballsdotie Cheers. Yet another great US show that was messed around this side of the Atlantic.
@kaaaaner @noriordan @ShamrockRovers Deffo played for first Rovers' team.
@kaaaaner @noriordan @ShamrockRovers It seemed bizarre at the time. Certainly unique. Had he been GAA you'd never hear the end of it.
@kaaaaner @noriordan @ShamrockRovers I recall a Con O'Donoghue playing for Rovers before heading to US to play American football. Tall lad!😀
@buzzoneill He's Boo Bear
@seidodge I'm not bitter. Irish football stood its ground and beat the money men.
@seidodge I was never as militant about anything in my life as I was about that.
@seidodge @ballsdotie @ConorNeville We won. They lost. Fuck right off.
@PhuckAllCraic Anyone can sue anyone else for any reason - if they want to. It's big stick syndrome.
Three episodes in and I've completely fallen in love with #Fleabag. Who's got Pheobe Waller-Bridge's phone number?
@buzzoneill Now, that's a man sandwich!
@cassette_media @EmmaAWheatley And looks like a character from Vinyl
@seidodge @RuiDunsta Ich bin ein *what's the Mexican word for 'Mexican?*
@PhuckAllCraic While his club career was patchwork his international career is peerless
@johngosullivan A boy amongst Omen
@pogmogoal I was watching the game in a suite in London's Dorchester Hotel while waiting to interview Richard Gere. #ThanksRobbie
@Stephenrice_6 And madman Dan Murray in short sleeves! Best snow ever though.
Dreadful and expensive draw for Dundalk.
@electionlit I'd love to see Italy ban Speedos. Why middle-aged and even elderly Italian males insist on wearing them is beyond me. TMI.
@SamanthaLibreri Any book by Tim Parks. A Season with Verona is a particular favourite. For obvious reasons.
@gleesonb Try Dice. It's funnier.
Don't play telly lotto: here's his week's TV Preview https://t.co/leEw2mDXPL https://t.co/n75O4A3OCW https://t.co/pFgUGhrece

So sad to hear about the death of Rovers' legend Liam Tuohy. One of Irish football's greatest as both a player and coach.
@SportsJOEdotie @DarrMurphy Welcome to the Italian football world of 'ritiro'
@IFTN @paddybreathnach @markohalloran @ElementPictures Paddy's big break was filming a video for Hallelujah Freedom about 700 years ago.
@swench Nice article Eamon. Tony was unique.
@DangerKidsBooks @OfficialASRoma @championat The man's got taste. Next stop: Tallaght Stadium.
@johngosullivan @OCowzer @DangerKidsBooks @Ciaran_O @little_football LoI was dying when there were 14 clubs so having 20 isn't the problem
@DeborahJaneOrr What? No Irn-Bru?
@paulohehir Was it a case of thanks but no tax?
@johngosullivan New corner flags for all should bring back the crowds
@RuiDunsta @FMcMack @AlbertoNardelli Baccala is the cod's bollocks 😎. Currently enjoying Lucca but still dreaming of Dar Poeta in Trastevere
@CorrAlan Marni Nixon was what Donald Runsfeld might call a great 'known unknown'
@DrNightdub @davidbyrne72 Check out Ravello. It's stunning. Yesterday was fantastic btw. I've never seen a happier happy couple.
@JoeCassidyIRE @philipfnolan Heading to Tallaght on a lovely night for a game. Going back to winter would be insane.

@TTsrfc @srfcandyc Don't get veneration of Spurs' game. Great moment but we lost. Belgrade was the magical night we won.
